measured_by: Positive and negative frames in attribute framing scenarios (modified ground beef scenario)
justification: The study applied attribute framing using a modified version of the ground beef scenario to assess participant susceptibility to framing effects as they aged.

measured_by: Positive and negative frames in goal framing scenarios (adapted breast self-exam scenario)
justification: Participants were exposed to goal framing scenarios adapted from Meyerowitz and Chaiken's breast self-exam scenario, allowing researchers to measure variations in framing effects by age.

measured_by: Positive and negative frames in risky choice framing scenarios (variation of Asian Disease Problem)
justification: Researchers utilized a variation of Tversky and Kahneman's Asian Disease Problem to evaluate risky choice framing effects across different age groups.

measured_by: Positive and negative frames across the age span
justification: The SST was addressed through the framing effects observed, with older adults prioritizing positive information to align with their present-oriented goals, as manifested in responses to various framing types.

measured_by: Participants' responses to framed scenarios as age changes
justification: The dual-process model was explored through participants' willingness to accept a riskier option in negative frames as they aged, influenced by both affective and deliberative systems.
